intro: Valeriana sichuanica, commonly known as Sichuan valerian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, dark purple flowers and branched, woody stems. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its rhizomes and roots are the primary parts used in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana sichuanica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats at moderate elevations.
